00015 # Answer evaluator which always marks things correct
00016 
00017 =head3 auto_right()
00018 
00019 =pod
00020 
00021     Usage: ANS(auto_right()); 
00022           or
00023                ANS(auto_right("this answer can be left blank"));
00024 
00025 This answer checker marks any answer correct.  It is useful when you want
00026 to leave multiple answer blanks, only some of which will be used.  If you
00027 turn off showing partial correct answers and partial credit, the effect is
00028 not visible to the students.  The comment in the second case is what will
00029 be displayed as the correct answer.  This helps avoid confusion.
00030 
00031 =cut
00032 
00033 # ^function auto_right
00034 # ^uses AnswerEvaluator::new
00035 # ^uses auto_right_checker
00036 sub auto_right {
00037         my $cmt = shift;
00038         my %params = @_;
00039         $cmt = '' unless defined($cmt);
00040         
00041         my $answerEvaluator = new AnswerEvaluator;
00042         $answerEvaluator->ans_hash(
00043             type => "auto_right", 
00044             correct_ans => "$cmt"
00045         );
00046         $answerEvaluator->install_pre_filter('reset');
00047         $answerEvaluator->install_evaluator(\&auto_right_checker,%params);
00048 
00049         return $answerEvaluator;
00050 }
00051 
00052 # used in auto_right above
00053 
00054 # ^function auto_right_checker
00055 sub auto_right_checker {
00056  my $ans = shift;
00057  $ans->score(1);
00058  return($ans);
00059 }
00060 
00061 
00062 =head3  no_decs()
00063 
00064 =pod
00065 
00066 Can be wrapped around an numerical evaluation.  It marks the answer wrong
00067 if it contains a decimal point.  Usage:
00068 
00069   ANS(no_decs(num_cmp("sqrt(3)")));
00070 
00071 This will accept "sqrt(3)" or "3^(1/2)" as answers, but not 1.7320508
00072 
00073 =cut
00074 
00075 # ^function no_decs
00076 # ^uses must_have_filter
00077 # ^uses raw_student_answer_filter
00078 # ^uses catch_errors_filter
00079 sub no_decs {
00080     my ($old_evaluator) = @_;
00081 
00082   my $msg= "Your answer contains a decimal.  You must provide an exact answer, e.g. sqrt(5)/3";
00083     $old_evaluator->install_pre_filter(must_have_filter(".", 'no', $msg));
00084     $old_evaluator->install_post_filter(\&raw_student_answer_filter);
00085     $old_evaluator->install_post_filter(\&catch_errors_filter);
00086 
00087     return $old_evaluator;
00088     }
00089 
00090 =head3     must_include()
00091 
00092 =pod
00093 
00094 Wrapper for other answer evaluators.  It insists that a string is part of
00095 the answer to be marked right. 
00096 
00097 =cut
00098 
00099 # ^function must_include
00100 # ^uses must_have_filter
00101 # ^uses raw_student_answer_filter
00102 # ^uses catch_errors_filter
00103 sub must_include {
00104     my ($old_evaluator) = shift;
00105     my $muststr = shift;
00106 
00107     $old_evaluator->install_pre_filter(must_have_filter($muststr));
00108     $old_evaluator->install_post_filter(\&raw_student_answer_filter);
00109     $old_evaluator->install_post_filter(\&catch_errors_filter);
00110     return $old_evaluator;
00111     }
00112 
00113 =head3      no_trig_fun()
00114 
00115 Wrapper for other answer evaluators.  It marks the answer wrong if
00116 it contains one of the six basic trig functions.
00117 
00118 This is useful if you want students to report the value of sin(pi/4),
00119 but you don't want to allow "sin(pi/4)" as the answer.
00120 
00121 A similar effect can be accomplished with Contexts() by undefining 
00122 the trig functions.  
00123 See http://webwork.maa.org/wiki/Modifying_contexts_%28advanced%29#.282.29_Functions
00124 
00125 
00126 =cut
00127 
00128 # ^function no_trig_fun
00129 # ^uses fun_cmp
00130 # ^uses must_have_filter
00131 # ^uses catch_errors_filter
00132 sub no_trig_fun {
00133     my ($ans) = shift;
00134     my $new_eval = fun_cmp($ans);
00135     my ($msg) = "Your answer to this problem may not contain a trig function.";
00136     $new_eval->install_pre_filter(must_have_filter("sin", 'no', $msg));
00137     $new_eval->install_pre_filter(must_have_filter("cos", 'no', $msg));
00138     $new_eval->install_pre_filter(must_have_filter("tan", 'no', $msg));
00139     $new_eval->install_pre_filter(must_have_filter("sec", 'no', $msg));
00140     $new_eval->install_pre_filter(must_have_filter("csc", 'no', $msg));
00141     $new_eval->install_pre_filter(must_have_filter("cot", 'no', $msg));
00142 
00143     $new_eval->install_post_filter(\&catch_errors_filter);
00144     return $new_eval;
00145 }
00146

00154 # ^uses num_cmp
00155 # ^uses must_have_filter
00156 # ^uses catch_errors_filter
00157 sub no_trig {
00158     my ($ans) = shift;
00159     my $new_eval = num_cmp($ans);
00160     my ($msg) = "Your answer to this problem may not contain a trig function.";
00161     $new_eval->install_pre_filter(must_have_filter("sin", 'no', $msg));
00162     $new_eval->install_pre_filter(must_have_filter("cos", 'no', $msg));
00163     $new_eval->install_pre_filter(must_have_filter("tan", 'no', $msg));
00164     $new_eval->install_pre_filter(must_have_filter("sec", 'no', $msg));
00165     $new_eval->install_pre_filter(must_have_filter("csc", 'no', $msg));
00166     $new_eval->install_pre_filter(must_have_filter("cot", 'no', $msg));
00167 
00168     $new_eval->install_post_filter(\&catch_errors_filter);
00169     return $new_eval;
00170 }

00178 # ^function exact_no_trig
00179 # ^uses num_cmp
00180 # ^uses no_decs
00181 # ^uses must_have_filter
00182 sub exact_no_trig {
00183     my ($ans) = shift;
00184     my $old_eval = num_cmp($ans);
00185     my $new_eval = no_decs($old_eval);
00186     my ($msg) = "Your answer to this problem may not contain a trig function.";
00187     $new_eval->install_pre_filter(must_have_filter("sin", 'no', $msg));
00188     $new_eval->install_pre_filter(must_have_filter("cos", 'no', $msg));
00189     $new_eval->install_pre_filter(must_have_filter("tan", 'no', $msg));
00190     $new_eval->install_pre_filter(must_have_filter("sec", 'no', $msg));
00191     $new_eval->install_pre_filter(must_have_filter("csc", 'no', $msg));
00192     $new_eval->install_pre_filter(must_have_filter("cot", 'no', $msg));
00193 
00194     return $new_eval;
00195 }

00198 =head3      must_have_filter()
00199 
00200 =pod
00201 
00202 Filter for checking that an answer has (or doesn't have) a certain
00203 string in it.  This can be used to screen answers where you want them
00204 in a particular form (e.g., if you allow most functions, but not trig
00205 functions in the answer, or if the answer must include some string).
00206      
00207 First argument is the string to have, or not have
00208 Second argument is optional, and tells us whether yes or no
00209 Third argument is the error message to produce (if any).
00210 
00211 A similar effect can be accomplished with Contexts() by undefining 
00212 the trig functions.  
00213 See http://webwork.maa.org/wiki/Modifying_contexts_%28advanced%29
00214 
00215 =cut
00216 
00217 
00218 # First argument is the string to have, or not have
00219 # Second argument is optional, and tells us whether yes or no
00220 # Third argument is the error message to produce (if any).
00221 # ^function must_have_filter
00222 sub must_have_filter {
00223     my $str = shift;
00224     my $yesno = shift;
00225     my $errm = shift;
00226 
00227     $str =~ s/\./\\./g;
00228     if(!defined($yesno)) {
00229         $yesno=1;
00230     } else {
00231         $yesno = ($yesno eq 'no') ? 0 :1;
00232     }
00233 
00234     my $newfilt = sub {
00235         my $num = shift;
00236         my $process_ans_hash = ( ref( $num ) eq 'AnswerHash' ) ? 1 : 0 ;
00237         my ($rh_ans);
00238         if ($process_ans_hash) {
00239             $rh_ans = $num;
00240             $num = $rh_ans->{original_student_ans};
00241         }
00242         my $is_ok = 0;
00243 
00244         return $is_ok unless defined($num);
00245 
00246         if (($yesno and ($num =~ /$str/)) or (!($yesno) and !($num=~ /$str/))) {
00247             $is_ok = 1;
00248         }
00249 
00250         if ($process_ans_hash)   {
00251             if ($is_ok == 1 ) {
00252                 $rh_ans->{original_student_ans}=$num;
00253                 return $rh_ans;
00254             } else {
00255                 if(defined($errm)) {
00256                     $rh_ans->{ans_message} = $errm;
00257                     $rh_ans->{student_ans} = $rh_ans->{original_student_ans};
00258 #                   $rh_ans->{student_ans} = "Your answer was \"$rh_ans->{original_student_ans}\". $errm";
00259                     $rh_ans->throw_error('SYNTAX', $errm);
00260                 } else {
00261                     $rh_ans->throw_error('NUMBER', "");
00262                 }
00263                 return $rh_ans;
00264             }
00265 
00266         } else {
00267             return $is_ok;
00268         }
00269     };
00270     return $newfilt;
00271 }
00272 
00273 =head3      catch_errors_filter()
00274 
00275 =cut
00276 
00277 # ^function catch_errors_filter
00278 sub catch_errors_filter {
00279     my ($rh_ans) = shift;
00280     if ($rh_ans->catch_error('SYNTAX') ) {
00281         $rh_ans->{ans_message} = $rh_ans->{error_message};
00282         $rh_ans->clear_error('SYNTAX');
00283     }
00284     if ($rh_ans->catch_error('NUMBER') ) {
00285         $rh_ans->{ans_message} = $rh_ans->{error_message};
00286         $rh_ans->clear_error('NUMBER');
00287     }
00288     $rh_ans;
00289 }

00293 
00294 
00295 =cut
00296 
00297 # ^function raw_student_answer_filter
00298 sub raw_student_answer_filter {
00299     my ($rh_ans) = shift;
00300 #   warn "answer was ".$rh_ans->{student_ans};
00301     $rh_ans->{student_ans} = $rh_ans->{original_student_ans}
00302         unless ($rh_ans->{student_ans} =~ /[a-zA-Z]/);
00303 #   warn "2nd time ... answer was ".$rh_ans->{student_ans};
00304 
00305     return $rh_ans;
00306 }

00308 =head3      no_decimal_list()
00309 
00310 
00311 
00312 =cut
00313 
00314 # ^function no_decimal_list
00315 # ^uses number_list_cmp
00316 sub no_decimal_list {
00317     my ($ans) = shift;
00318     my (%jopts) = @_;
00319     my $old_evaluator = number_list_cmp($ans);
00320 
00321     my $answer_evaluator = sub {
00322         my $tried = shift;
00323         my $ans_hash;
00324             if  ( ref($old_evaluator) eq 'AnswerEvaluator' ) { # new style
00325                 $ans_hash = $old_evaluator->evaluate($tried);
00326             } elsif (ref($old_evaluator) eq  'CODE' )     { #old style
00327                 $ans_hash = &$old_evaluator($tried);
00328         }
00329         if(defined($jopts{'must'}) && ! ($tried =~ /$jopts{'must'}/)) {
00330             $ans_hash->{score}=0;
00331             $ans_hash->setKeys( 'ans_message' => 'Your answer needs to be exact.');
00332         }
00333         if($tried =~ /\./) {
00334             $ans_hash->{score}=0;
00335             $ans_hash->setKeys( 'ans_message' => 'You may not use decimals in your answer.');
00336         }
00337         return $ans_hash;
00338     };
00339     return $answer_evaluator;
00340 }

00349 # ^function no_decimals
00350 # ^uses std_num_cmp
00351 sub no_decimals {
00352     my ($ans) = shift;
00353     my (%jopts) = @_;
00354     my $old_evaluator = std_num_cmp($ans);
00355 
00356     my $answer_evaluator = sub {
00357         my $tried = shift;
00358         my $ans_hash;
00359             if  ( ref($old_evaluator) eq 'AnswerEvaluator' ) { # new style
00360                 $ans_hash = $old_evaluator->evaluate($tried);
00361             } elsif (ref($old_evaluator) eq  'CODE' )     { #old style
00362                 $ans_hash = &$old_evaluator($tried);
00363         }
00364         if(defined($jopts{'must'}) && ! ($tried =~ /$jopts{'must'}/)) {
00365             $ans_hash->{score}=0;
00366             $ans_hash->setKeys( 'ans_message' => 'Your answer needs to be exact.');
00367         }
00368         if($tried =~ /\./) {
00369             $ans_hash->{score}=0;
00370             $ans_hash->setKeys( 'ans_message' => 'You may not use decimals in your answer.');
00371         }
00372         return $ans_hash;
00373     };
00374     return $answer_evaluator;
00375 }

00377 =head3      with_comments()
00378 
00379 
00380     # Wrapper for an answer evaluator which can also supply comments
00381 
00382 =cut
00383 
00384 # Wrapper for an answer evaluator which can also supply comments
00385 
00386 # ^function with_comments
00387 sub with_comments {
00388     my ($old_evaluator, $cmt) = @_;
00389 
00390 #   $mdm = $main::displayMode;
00391 #   $main::displayMode = 'HTML_tth';
00392 #   $cmt = EV2($cmt);
00393 #   $main::displayMode =$mdm;
00394 
00395     my $ans_evaluator =  sub  {
00396         my $tried = shift;
00397         my $ans_hash;
00398 
00399         if  ( ref($old_evaluator) eq 'AnswerEvaluator' ) { # new style
00400             $ans_hash = $old_evaluator->evaluate($tried);
00401         } elsif (ref($old_evaluator) eq  'CODE' )     { #old style
00402             $ans_hash = &$old_evaluator($tried);
00403         } else {
00404             warn "There is a problem using the answer evaluator";
00405         }
00406 
00407     if($ans_hash->{score}>0) {
00408       $ans_hash -> setKeys( 'ans_message' => $cmt);
00409     }
00410         return $ans_hash;
00411     };
00412 
00413   $ans_evaluator;
00414 }

00417 =head3      pc_evaluator()
00418 
00419 
00420         # Wrapper for multiple answer evaluators, it takes a list of the following as inputs
00421         # [answer_evaluator, partial credit factor, comment]
00422         # it applies evaluators from the list until it hits one with positive credit,
00423         # weights it by the partial credit factor, and throws in its comment
00424 
00425 
00426 =cut
00427 
00428 
00429 # Wrapper for multiple answer evaluators, it takes a list of the following as inputs
00430 # [answer_evaluator, partial credit factor, comment]
00431 # it applies evaluators from the list until it hits one with positive credit,
00432 # weights it by the partial credit factor, and throws in its comment
00433 # ^function pc_evaluator
00434 sub pc_evaluator {
00435         my @ev_list;
00436         if(ref($_[0]) ne 'ARRAY') {
00437                 warn "Improper input to pc_evaluator";
00438         }
00439         if(ref($_[0]->[0]) ne 'ARRAY') {
00440                 @ev_list = @_;
00441         } else {
00442                 @ev_list = @{$_[0]};
00443         }
00444         
00445         my $ans_evaluator =  sub  {
00446                 my $tried = shift;
00447                 my $ans_hash;
00448                 for($j=0;$j<scalar(@ev_list); $j++) {
00449                         my $old_evaluator = $ev_list[$j][0];
00450                         my $cmt = $ev_list[$j][2];
00451                         my $weight = $ev_list[$j][1];
00452                         $weight = 1 unless defined($weight);
00453 
00454                         if  ( ref($old_evaluator) eq 'AnswerEvaluator' ) { # new style
00455                                 $ans_hash = $old_evaluator->evaluate($tried);
00456                         } elsif (ref($old_evaluator) eq  'CODE' )     { #old style
00457                                 $ans_hash = &$old_evaluator($tried);
00458                         } else {
00459                                 warn "There is a problem using the answer evaluator";
00460                         }
00461                         
00462                         if($ans_hash->{score}>0) {
00463                                 $ans_hash -> setKeys( 'ans_message' => $cmt) if defined($cmt);
00464                                 $ans_hash->{score} *= $weight;
00465                                 return $ans_hash;
00466                         };
00467                 };
00468                 return $ans_hash;
00469         };
00470         
00471   $ans_evaluator;
00472 }

00476 =head3      weighted_partial_grader
00477 
00478 =pod
00479 
00480 This is a grader which weights the different parts of the problem
00481 differently.  The weights passed to it through the environment.  In
00482 the problem:
00483 
00484  $ENV{'partial_weights'} = [.2,.2,.2,.3];
00485 
00486 This will soon be superceded by a better grader.
00487 
00488 =cut
00489 
00490 # ^function weighted_partial_grader
00491 # ^uses $ENV{grader_message}
00492 # ^uses $ENV{partial_weights}
00493 sub weighted_partial_grader {
00494     my $rh_evaluated_answers = shift;
00495     my $rh_problem_state = shift;
00496     my %form_options = @_;
00497     my %evaluated_answers = %{$rh_evaluated_answers};
00498         #  The hash $rh_evaluated_answers typically contains: 
00499         #      'answer1' => 34, 'answer2'=> 'Mozart', etc.
00500        
00501         # By default the  old problem state is simply passed back out again.
00502     my %problem_state = %$rh_problem_state;
00503         
00504         
00505         # %form_options might include
00506         # The user login name 
00507         # The permission level of the user
00508         # The studentLogin name for this psvn.
00509         # Whether the form is asking for a refresh or
00510         #     is submitting a new answer.
00511         
00512         # initial setup of the answer
00513     my      $total=0; 
00514         my %problem_result = ( score => 0,
00515                 errors => '',
00516                 type => 'custom_problem_grader',
00517                 msg => $ENV{'grader_message'}
00518                                );
00519 
00520 
00521     # Return unless answers have been submitted
00522     unless ($form_options{answers_submitted} == 1) {
00523         return(\%problem_result,\%problem_state);
00524     }
00525         # Answers have been submitted -- process them.
00526         
00527         ########################################################
00528         # Here's where we compute the score.  The variable     #
00529         # $numright is the number of correct answers.          #
00530         ########################################################
00531 
00532 
00533     my      $numright=0;
00534     my      $i;
00535     my      $ans_ref;
00536 
00537     warn "Partial value weights not defined" if not defined($ENV{'partial_weights'});
00538     my      @partial_weights = @{$ENV{'partial_weights'}};
00539     my      $total_weight=0;
00540 
00541     # Renormalize weights so they add to 1
00542     for $i (@partial_weights) { $total_weight += $i; }
00543     warn("Weights do not add to a positive number") unless ($total_weight >0);
00544     for $i (0..$#partial_weights) { $partial_weights[$i] /= $total_weight; }
00545 
00546     $i = 1;
00547     my $nextanswername = $PG->new_label($i);
00548     while (defined($ans_ref = $evaluated_answers{$nextanswername})) { 
00549       $total += $ans_ref->{score}*$partial_weights[$i-1];
00550       $i++;
00551       $nextanswername = $PG->new_label($i);
00552     }
00553     
00554     $problem_result{score} = $total; 
00555         # increase recorded score if the current score is greater.
00556     $problem_state{recorded_score} = $problem_result{score} if $problem_result{score} > $problem_state{recorded_score};
00557 
00558     $problem_state{num_of_correct_ans}++ if $total == 1;
00559     $problem_state{num_of_incorrect_ans}++ if $total < 1 ;
00560         
00561     (\%problem_result, \%problem_state);
00562 }
00563 
00564 1;
